alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Madison; Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 3:15AM CST until January 27 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Paint Rock River NEAR Woodville affecting Jackson, Marshall and Madison Counties. For the PAINT ROCK RIVER...including Woodville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Paint Rock River near Woodville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Saturday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 17.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 01/05/1972. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Noon CST today.this afternoon at 315 PM CST.
